LanguageData.TKUtils.Experimental: This setting is experimental and may change, or be removed, at any time.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Emojis.Label: Use emojis in some commands.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Emojis.Description: Emojis are used in place of text to help provide quick, easy, and compact information in dense commands, such as !mypawnhealth.
LanguageData.TKUtils.HairColor.Label: Dye viewer's hair color to match their chat color.
LanguageData.TKUtils.HairColor.Description: Twitch Toolkit, by default, dyes their pawn's hair color to match the color their username is. This setting allows you to disable this functionality in-case your viewers want a specific hair color.
LanguageData.TKUtils.DumpStyle.Label: Json output style
LanguageData.TKUtils.DumpStyle.Description: How ToolkitUtils will store its data. When single file is selected, all data will be merged into one massive file originally known as ShopExt.json. When multi-file is selected, all data will be stored in separate files for every unique set of data.
LanguageData.TKUtils.OffloadShop.Label: Offload saving shop data to a separate thread.
LanguageData.TKUtils.OffloadShop.Description: By default, all data is saved on the game's thread. As a result, this tends to block the game's thread when large amounts of data needs to be written to disk. Enabling this setting instructs the mod to save all data using a separate thread.
LanguageData.TKUtils.StoreRate.Label: The number of items the store will process per tick.
LanguageData.TKUtils.StoreRate.Description: With a previous update, Utils made Toolkit's store immediately visible. Utils runs a background task to ensure the store is up-to-date with the latest items in the game. This setting changes how many items it will process per tick until complete.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CoinRate.Label: Show a viewer's calculated coin rate in the balance command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CoinRate.Description: When enabled, the balance command will include the viewer's income per coin reward cycle.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CommandParser.Label: Use Utils' flavor of command handling.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CommandParser.Description: Older users would remember this as its command parser.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CommandPrefix.Label: Command prefix
LanguageData.TKUtils.CommandPrefix.Description:
The prefix to use for all Twitch Toolkit commands.
Prefixes cannot start with a:
 - /
 - .
 - contain spaces
LanguageData.TKUtils.ToolkitStyleCommands.Label: Locate commands similar to how Twitch Toolkit does.
LanguageData.TKUtils.ToolkitStyleCommands.Description: Twitch Toolkit compares commands by checking to see if a message starts with a command, while ToolkitUtils checks to see if the first "word" is a command. If this is enabled, ToolkitUtils will mimic the old behavior, with the exception of case insensitivity. TL;DR: this lets !balloon be a valid form of the !bal command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.DecorateUtils.Label: Add a little star beside Utils in the mod list command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.VersionedModList.Label: Include mod versions in the mod list command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.VersionedModList.Description: Inserts mod versions, if Utils could find one, into the !installedmods command's output.
LanguageData.TKUtils.BuyItemBalance.Label: Show a viewer's remaining balance after buying an item.
LanguageData.TKUtils.BuyItemBalance.Description: Inserts the viewer's new balance after successfully buying an item. This does not work when the "confirmation messages" setting is disabled in Twitch Toolkit.
LanguageData.TKUtils.LookupLimit.Label: Maximum number of results in the lookup command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.LookupLimit.Description: The maximum number of results that can be displayed in the !lookup command. Setting this to higher values may result in walls of text if a viewer uses with broad terms.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnKind.Label: Allow viewers to specify their pawn's kind when buying.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnKind.Description: Completely disables the ability to specify a viewer's pawn kind when purchasing a pawn. Any pawn purchases will default to Human, even if it's disabled in the pawn kind config.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Abandon.Method.Label: How pawns should leave when the leave command is invoked.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Abandon.Method.Description: The type of leave method that'll be used when a viewer uses the !leave command. The "Mental break" method will force the colonist to leave the colony, while the "Thanos" method will turn the colonist to dust.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Abandon.Gear.Label: Colonists that leave by the leave command drop their inventory.
LanguageData.TKUtils.Abandon.Gear.Description: If a viewer chooses to leave the colony via the !leave command, the mod will strip their equipment before they depart.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnGear.Temperature.Label: Show temperature information in the pawn gear command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnGear.Temperature.Description: Include a pawn's temperature tolerance range in the !mypawngear command. Enabling this removes temperature information from !mypawnbody.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnGear.Apparel.Label: Show currently equipped apparel in the pawn gear command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnGear.Apparel.Description: Include a pawn's current apparel in the !mypawngear command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnGear.Armor.Label: Show armor values in the pawn gear command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnGear.Armor.Description: Include armor protection values in the !mypawngear command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnGear.Weapon.Label: Show currently equipped weapon in the pawn gear command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnGear.Weapon.Description: Includes the weapon a pawn is currently equipped with in the !mypawngear command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnHealth.Surgeries.Label: Show queued surgeries in the pawn health command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnHealth.Surgeries.Description: Includes currently queued surgeries in the !mypawnhealth command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnRelations.OpinionThreshold.D: The minimum opinion a pawn has to have of another before they'll show up in the command. The value will be used for both the negative (absolute) and positive opinion values
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnWork.Sort.Label: Sort work priorities in the pawn work command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnWork.Sort.Description: If enabled, work priorities will be sorted like the Work tab in the !mypawnwork command. This means work will be displayed as the Work tab from left to right.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnWork.Filter.Label: Filter work priorities in the pawn work command.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PawnWork.Filter.Description: If enabled, disabled work priorities will be removed from the !mypawnwork command's output. This means work priorities a pawn is incapable of doing, or is not assigned to, will be omitted from the command's response.
